content.description: Sit start under the southeast arete (to the right of the clean vertical face) on an obvious right hand sidepull and left hand pinching just above it. Climb straight up using careful, balanced moves to reach a good hold on the arete. Span the left hand across to the opposing arete and move straight upwards, topping out at the apex of the boulder.

Stand start on the southwest arete (left of the clean vertical face) with a left hand about shoulder height on a small sidepull in the vertical crack and right hand about hip height on a decent edge (can choose from a couple without changing the grade). Move straight up and slightly left to hit a good crimp rail and then cruise it to the top.The sit start has not been done and should go around V7

Start on the south face using left sidepull and right hand on slopey sidepull dish, both at about shoulder height. Compress your way straight upwards making use of holds on either arete and careful footwork. One of the best in the Douglas State Forest for sure.
content.location: On the sheer, dagger shaped feature facing the pond

content.description: A peaceful boulder just off shore from a beautiful secluded pond. "The Dagger" is a pointed, fifteen foot boulder and has four different high quality lines in total.
